message:
Hey Stephen,

That will introduce unused variable warnings instead. I could disable warnings, but both solutions seems sort of hacky to me. I find that I very often run into this pattern that deserves a prettier solution; Doing stuff that is not related to current function but should run in current synchronisation context. To me, it seems like the async await library is the first major C# feature that isn't fully thought through. Unless I'm missing something and should think differently to solve the problem the function above attempts to.

Thanks again ;)  
Anders
